full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Request for Proposal: Supply and Delivery of Girardin Micro Bird G5 Type-A School Bus

### Notice Information

* Reference Number: WS3979087326 - Doc4053045082
* Solicitation Number: WS3979087326
* Publication Date: June 14, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: August 4, 2023 (14:00 EDT)
* Notice URL: <http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16568762?extsite=MTY1Njg3NjJfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==>

### Contract Overview

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) on behalf of the Department of Transport Canada (TC) invites industry to submit a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the supply and delivery of one (1) Girardin Micro Bird G5 Type-A School Bus.

### Terms and Conditions

* The bid submission deadline is August 4, 2023 (14:00 EDT). Late bids will be declared non-responsive.
* All required supporting documentation must be submitted with the bid.
* The successful supplier will be required to deliver one (1) Girardin Micro Bird G5 Type-A School Bus as outlined in Annex “A” – Pricing and Annex “B” – Specifications – Girardin Micro Bird G5 Type-A School Bus.

### Contact Information

* Matheson, Valerie (SPAC/PSPC)
* Email: <valerie.matheson@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca>
* Phone: Not available
* Fax: Not available

### Procurement Details

* UNSPSC Code: 25101502 - Busses
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Lowest Price
* Trade Agreements: Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement

### Delivery and Service Areas

* Delivery: Canada
* Service: National

### How to Submit aBid

* Bids must be submitted electronically through Ariba Discovery.
* All required supporting documentation must be submitted with the bid.

The above entry is more clear and organized than the original text provided by the contractors. All requirements, specifications, and important details are clearly mentioned, so there is no need to include
